alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 8:26AM EDT until June 17 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... Southeastern Gibson County in southwestern Indiana... Pike County in southwestern Indiana... * Until 815 AM CDT. * At 726 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near St. Francisville to Owensville to 6 miles south of New Harmony, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lynnville, Petersburg, Newburgh, Chandler, Folsomville and Boonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 6 and 7, near Mile Marker 22, and between Mile Markers 38 and 52. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 30 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
